column4: llutzDo I need to have squid setup in order to make ssh tunneling work?
no
putty - connections - ssh - tunnels - Source Port 7070 /Destination localhost Dynamic/Auto - Add
create an "dynamic tunnel" and setup your browser to use it as socks5 proxy on localhost:port
I configured it like you stated but I can't pull a page, not even via ip address on that network
have you configured your browser accordingly?
I have IE set to use a proxy server of localhost port 7070, and bypass proxy on local addresses
it has to be SOCKS proxy, not normal (http) proxy
ok, I went into the advanced settings and put local host and port 7070 in SOCKS
localhost without space. see http://bit.ly/d7Ne5N
should I use the word localhost, even if that is not the name of my server?
it has to be "localhost" in putty AND in IE
exactly that word, not your host
still no good, I don't understand why, it can't be my firewall at this place, because I am able to make the ssh connection  :(
still no good, I don't understand why, it can't be my firewall at this place, because I am able to make the ssh connection  :(
have you checked the settings twice (port, dynamic/auto selected)?
I have checked it multiple times
no idea then, sorry
after I hit add it populates with D7070 in PuTTY
thats right
I got it......I had to disconnect everything and reconnect.....strange that I did that before, but I guess it never took
anyway, it works, fine
Oooh, I also added "Do not use Proxy server with the following addresses  *.mydomain.com
Thank you so much for your help.....
